content.body: yulia: I recently added additional information to the explainer for the resource management proposal based on your feedback that some additional context around how this could be integrated into DOM APIs should be included. If you have some time, could you peruse https://github.com/tc39/proposal-explicit-resource-management#relation-to-dom-apis and let me know if that was what you were looking for?

content.body:
> <@ljharb:matrix.org> fwiw, vscode has a setting that should enable syntax highlighting:
> 
> ```
> "files.associations": {
>   "*.emu": "html"
> }
> ```

I really need to dust of my ecmarkup vscode extension, I haven't had the time to work in it in a few years now
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ljharb:matrix.org

fwiw, vscode has a setting that should enable syntax highlighting:

"files.associations": {
  "*.emu": "html"
}
I really need to dust of my ecmarkup vscode extension, I haven't had the time to work in it in a few years now

content.body: The value in a different extension is in language service functionality that could differ from regular HTML, which can't otherwise be easily distinguished from the content of the file itself.
content.formatted_body: The value in a different extension is in language service functionality that could differ from regular HTML, which can't otherwise be easily distinguished from the content of the file itself.

content.body: For example, my ecmarkup extension supported go to definition and other features inside of `<emu-grammar>` tags
content.formatted_body: For example, my ecmarkup extension supported go to definition and other features inside of <emu-grammar> tags
